item.title: Get involved
item.description: Get involved There are various ways how you can get involved including contributions on GitHub : https://github.com/eclipse/thingweb.node-wot/ Create and contribute your own protocols bindings besides HTTP, CoAP, Websockets, ... Build your WoT solutions and share them Report any issue you encounter (and even better provide already a fix) Facts Dual-licensed: Eclipse Public License v. 2.0 and W3C Software Notice and Document License (2015-05-13) NodeJS-based (see here for detailed prerequisites) Available through NPM (pick the packages you need: e.

item.title: Hands-on
item.description: Web of Things - hands-on This document aims to introduce the Web of Things (WoT) as building blocks for applications based on the IoT devices. As a growing area, IoT services and application have a huge potential. From home automation to smart-grid passing by industrial manufacturers, IoT is gaining popularity as a potential solution to address their need. Several technologies can be used to build an IoT application mainly because of the specific constraints of the devices.
